appearances.title: The Arena With Kasie Hunt : CNNW : January 2, 2026 1:00pm-2:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: joining me now, democratic congressman of illinois, raja krishnamoorthi. he sits on the house oversight committee, which of course has been conducting its own investigation into the epstein case. congressman, thanks so much for taking the time. >> thank you so much, jim. >> so i mean, by law and i and i've read the legislation, all of this should have been out two weeks ago. it's not. they're still reviewing kind of coming out in dribs and drabs. are they not following the law here? >> they're not in compliance. that's exactly right. i think that not only are they not in compliance, but it's just been kind of a chaotic rollout. it's been a rollout where they've taken extreme care to redact any reference to donald trump. but they've been careless with regard to redacting names of survivors, which is in direct contravention of the law. i, i also feel that they're feeling the heat from people across the political spectrum, not just democrats, but also their maga base. and so i think that they are, they kind of understand the political imperative and the publi

appearances.title: The Last Word With Lawrence O'Donnell : MSNOW : January 9, 2026 7:00pm-8:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: joining us now, democratic congressman raja krishnamoorthi of illinois.ressman, today you introduced the no occupation of venezuela or nova act in the house of representatives. what exactly would it prevent trump from doing in venezuela? >> well, thank you so much. basically, joaquin castro and i introduced this bill to basically make it clear that taxpayer funds should not be used to occupy or, quote unquote, run venezuela. and your setup piece explained exactly why we need this legislation, because we fear that taxpayer resources are going to be used essentially to subsidize oil companies exploitation of venezuelan oil resources. and, you know, when these oil executives came to the white house today and said, you know, it's uninvestable and, you know, it's going to take a lot of money and resources. that is kind of a wake up call to the rest of us, in the sense that we are the ones we, the taxpayers, will be on the hook for providing those incentives and resources to basically help trump realize his vision of basically, you know, taking over venezuelan

appearances.title: CNN Newsroom With Fredricka Whitfield : CNNW : January 4, 2026 11:00am-12:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: i'm joined now by democratic congressman raja krishnamoorthi of illinois.congressman, thanks so much for being with us. i know you sit on the house intelligence committee. i want to start by having you listen to what your republican colleague, marjorie taylor greene, had to say this morning when asked if this serves president trump, so-called america first policy. listen to this. >> my pushback here is if if this was really about narco terrorists and about protecting americans from cartels and drugs being brought into america, the trump administration would be attacking the mexican cartels. now, i am not defending maduro. and of course, i'm happy for the people of venezuela to be liberated. but americans celebrated the liberation of the iraqi people after saddam hussein. they celebrated the liberation of the libyan people after gadhafi. and this is the same washington playbook that we are so sick and tired of that doesn't serve the american people. >> so what's your reaction to that, congressman >> i actually agree with a lot of her sentiments. she's correc

appearances.title: The Weekend : MSNOW : January 4, 2026 4:00am-7:01am PST
appearances.snippet: now we are joined by democratic congressman raja krishnamoorthi.ht have heard. our conversation with ranking member smith, but i want to continue and jump off of that. and we've done a lot of analysis and questioning around how the ousting of maduro fits and squares into the trump administration's strategy and political strategy and the the make america great again ethos. but i'm wondering how you think it squares when you take a 30,000 foot step back into the democratic party platform. there are some members, a handful whose statements have read a slightly permissive of what the administration has done. at this point. maduro is gone. the country could descend into complete chaos, causing great instability in the region. one how would you characterize the party's attitude towards nation building? and two, do you want and do other members, democratic members at this point want this transition to succeed? >> well, we want to transition. >> but we don't want to occupy. >> the country. >> i have not i have not met a single person, whether it's a democr

appearances.title: The Weekend: Primetime : MSNOW : January 3, 2026 3:00pm-6:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: joining us now is democratic congressman raja krishnamoorthi of illinois.e intelligence and oversight committees. congressman, it's good to have you with us. i know it's been a long day. can you give us a sense, if you have been briefed at all, if you have gotten any kind of intelligence briefings in your oversight responsibilities as a member of congress over the past 14 hours or so? >> no. and we didn't have intelligence briefings even before that. with regard to much of what's happened in venezuela, which has been an ongoing problem. look, i just have two observations. one, i think that as as mr. ignatius said before, i think that the day after is the big issue, that my constituents and others have a big problem with. they don't want to be part of a civil war in venezuela. they don't want to occupy venezuela. they don't want any part of another iraq or afghanistan scenario in venezuela. and that's in part why a war powers resolution must come to the floor. we must debate it. and if the republicans want to occupy venezuela, they need to go and debate that
